title: Fragility, Conflict, and Migration Initiative
text:
Fragility, Conflict, and Migration Initiative


Strengthening National Capacities and Policies for Food Systems Analysis and Transformation in Kenya, Ghana, and Senegal


Agri-food system and policy landscaping in Niger
This proposal is to support the Niger Mission with an agri-food system and policy landscape analysis to better understand primary stakeholders, capacity gaps and the potential for various agri-food sectors to drive economic development in line with the following objectives:

Mapping of Niger's agri-food system



Identify the major capacity gaps within the agricultural sector



Provide recommendations for areas of potential growth that might serve as a driver for economic development, poverty reduction, and resilience to shocks



Provide recommendations for how the capacity in the sector and business enabling environment might be improved



Projet d’Appui à la transformation des Systèmes agro-alimentaires au Burundi (PATSAB)

Objectif général :

Contribuer de manière durable à la réduction de la pauvreté, à travers l’augmentation des revenus des petits exploitants agricoles, et à l’amélioration de la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des populations vulnérables, surtout les petits exploitants agricoles et leurs communautés

Objectifs spécifiques


Renforcer les capacités de production des petits producteurs (y compris pour la production d’aliments à haute valeur nutritive), en améliorant leur organisation et accès aux facteurs de production
Soutenir l’intégration des petits producteurs aux marchés de demande structurée dans le pays à travers l’accès aux marchés structurés et rémunérateurs
Renforcer les capacités des ménages agricoles à adopter des pratiques alimentaires et nutritionnelles saines

title: Aboubacar HEMA
text:
Aboubacar Hema is a Research Analyst in the Development Strategies and Governance Unit. He is a data scientist, statistician, and software developer. Prior to joining IFPRI, Aboubacar worked as a data analyst with the International Organization for Migration (IOM), where he successfully implemented and analyzed the MHPSS surveys (round 1-3) as well as the endline surveys for Senegal, Guinea, Nigeria, and Gambia. He also worked as a statistician with the Senegalese Institute for Agricultural Research (ISRA-BAME), as well as with the Consortium for Economic and Social Research (CRES), where he was involved in the design, implementation, and analysis of various household surveys, and as an R developer (sdmApp package) with the French Agricultural Research Center for International Development (CIRAD).
Aboubacar earned a MicroMaster in Statistics and Data Science at MIT, where he learned the foundations of data science, statistics, and machine learning, using big data and probabilistic modelling to extract meaningful information for decision-making. He graduated from the National School of Statistics and Economic Analysis in Dakar and has a license 3 in Computer Science from the University of Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso.
